text: Just saw a LinkedIn Influencer with 'Organic Growth' written in the profile with 65K+ followers claiming that he can help you in growing your platform, copying the posts from other influencers.

Jobseekers, this one‚Äôs for you.
 Every application, every interview, every follow-up‚Ä¶ the pressure is immense.
 And I know what you're thinking: Am I not good enough? 
 But let me tell you, this isn‚Äôt about you or your skills. It‚Äôs about a broken system where 60% of applicants never hear back. 
 Your mental health is not worth sacrificing for a system that doesn‚Äôt acknowledge your worth. 
 Please remember, taking care of yourself is the real priority. 
 Your dream job will come, but for now, breathe. üåª
Looking for jobs on LinkedIn is like online dating: Full of promises, but in the end, you‚Äôre just left ghosted.

LinkedIn scams be like: 'Congratulations, you've been selected for a role you didn‚Äôt even apply for!' 
 The catch? Pay Rs. 50,000 for the honor.

sapne dekhna achi baat hai,
lekin job ka sapna dekh ke 'interested' likhna,
yeh toh achi baat nahi hai na?

Next time when I'll be reading some LinkedIn Influencer's story, I am starting from the last line.
If there's a link attached to it, it's most probably a fake one.
Saves me time!

Every time I poured my heart into 5-6 rounds of interviews and faced rejection, it felt like a punch in the gut. The sleepless nights, the endless preparation, all for nothing.

But looking back, I realize it wasn‚Äôt nothing. It was the Universe‚Äôs way of saying, ‚ÄúNot this one, something better is on the way.‚Äù

Every single time, I‚Äôve been shown why that rejection happened.

Doors I thought I wanted to walk through were shut, only to have the right ones swing open.

The kind that aligned with my growth, my values, and my happiness.

At first, it stung. It hurt deeply. But now, when things don‚Äôt go as planned, I don‚Äôt panic.

I don‚Äôt question my worth. I sit back, breathe, and trust. The Universe knows.

I know there's another plan waiting. Something bigger, better, and just for me.

To anyone feeling the weight of rejection: trust that the closed doors are protecting you from something you can‚Äôt see right now.

Your path is being cleared for something even more beautiful.

To everyone who's still looking for a job...

I see you. I feel you. üíî

Every rejection email feels like a punch in the gut, and every 'We'll get back to you' sounds more like 'You'll never hear from us.'

But I want you to know, you're not alone in this. üå∏

According to a study, 80% of jobseekers struggle with anxiety and self-doubt during their search. It's normal to feel lost, but it's not the end.

Take breaks, breathe, and remember, this doesn't define you. Your worth is not tied to an offer letter. üí•

Your mental health matters more than any job.

Sometimes, we forget that a company‚Äôs brand name doesn‚Äôt define someone‚Äôs talent. It‚Äôs easy to get caught up in the 'big company = big talent' mindset, but that's not always the case.

I‚Äôve had the privilege of working with people from smaller companies (lesser known) who blow me away with their skills and dedication. They don‚Äôt need a fancy title or a famous brand behind them to prove their worth.

I've seen the other side too‚Äîpeople in top-tier companies feeling lost, overwhelmed, or stuck, even though the world sees them as 'successful'.

Let‚Äôs stop attaching someone‚Äôs value to the company they work for. Freshers especially need to hear this‚Äîskills are what matter, not the size of the company behind them.

At the end of the day, happiness and growth don‚Äôt come from a brand name, they come from doing what you love and constantly improving your craft.

So when I left a toxic work environment, I told my manager a simple thing and felt so good üòØ

I just said-

'Hope your son gets a manager like you.
I hope that the manager behaves the same way as you did with me.
Thank you.'

Now tell me 1 thing-

She always said that she was a great manager.
Why will she get offended?

I just told her that I wish her son would get a manager like she was.

If you felt bad, then that means you were a bad manager and now you know it. üêù

If you feel good, then take it as a blessing for your son and you'll really want someone to treat your son/daughter in the same way.

She cannot be even angry with me else it'll prove that she was not a 'great' manager.

Muskan - 1
Manager - 0

Muskan -> Aura +100000000

(Fictional message unfortunately :()

Hope you all become the people that your sons/daughters will like to work under üôè

There are a lot of bad people/things, bring a small change and break the chain :)

The world wigs out...thanks to India, The fact that we need to export more and import less is a given. Looking at uncool ideas and not the flavour of the season makes sense in so many places. I'm guessing the odds of succeeding here in entrepreneurship are likely higher compared to stamping AI on a bunch of random things...

As Generative AI finds its place in the legal space, it doesn‚Äôt seek to replace the hands that craft justice, but rather to lighten their load. It allows lawyers to step deeper into their role as strategists and thinkers, elevating their focus. Could this, then, be the next big leap?

The current thesis I have‚Ä¶ thesis, passion, fascination, is to watch Indian startups kill it in today‚Äôs ecosystem. I hope that a lot of the companies we support will retell the Indian story, the real one, without any baggage from the past. It's our decade. WTFund is India‚Äôs premier non-dilutive grant fund for emerging entrepreneurs under 25. Through the first WTFund Cohort (C1/24), 9 startups with 15 young founders under the age of 25, were shortlisted and these are some of the coolest ones we discovered.. The second cohort applications are now open and if you are a young entrepreneur under or at the age of 25, you should apply.

When I speak about AI, I often say that doctors leveraging AI are more effective than AI alone‚Äîand far more effective than doctors not using AI at all. This belief reflects my optimism for AI as a transformative tool in medicine. However, this study shared by Allie K. Miller paints a different, eye-opening and somehow concerning picture. According to JAMA Network Open, ChatGPT alone achieved a remarkable 90% diagnostic accuracy. Surprisingly, doctors using ChatGPT for assistance only scored 76%‚Äîbarely better than those without AI support (74%). Why is this happening? Two challenges stand out: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Overconfidence: Doctors sometimes ignored ChatGPT‚Äôs correct diagnoses if they conflicted with their own reasoning. This highlights the need for AI to better explain the 'why' behind its recommendations, fostering trust without manipulation. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Underuse: Many doctors treat AI as a glorified Google search. Instead of fully engaging with the data‚Äîe.g., inputting detailed patient histories and analyzing responses‚Äîthey miss the true potential of tools like ChatGPT.

AI in 2024: A Leadership Opportunity, Not Just a Technology Shift. AI is no longer just transforming industries‚Äîit‚Äôs reshaping what it means to lead effectively. As a leadership coach, I see this as a critical moment for leaders to step up and embrace AI strategically. If we fail to lead with purpose in this era, we risk falling behind. Here are four principles I believe every leader should consider: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Generative AI: It‚Äôs About Value, Not Just Tools Generative AI is changing the game across industries, but tools alone won‚Äôt drive impact. Leaders must ask: How does AI align with our strategy? How can it amplify human potential? The best leaders ensure AI innovation delivers tangible business value and empowers their teams. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Focus on People, Not Just Systems AI doesn‚Äôt replace people‚Äîit enhances their potential. Organizations thriving with AI are those investing in upskilling their teams and fostering cross-functional collaboration. As I often remind leaders: Your team‚Äôs ability to adapt to AI reflects your ability to lead with vision and empathy. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Ethical Leadership in AI With great power comes great responsibility. AI demands leaders address challenges like bias, ethical concerns, and security risks. Governance frameworks are essential for building trust and ensuring AI initiatives create sustainable, positive impact. 4Ô∏è‚É£ Leadership as Strategy Architect The divide between AI leaders and laggards is growing. The most effective leaders are embedding AI into their core strategies‚Äînot treating it as a one-off initiative. Are you driving transformation or just reacting to trends?
If you want media attention - either be interesting or be ready to spend money. You can‚Äôt be boring & unidimensional and expect media to give you free PR.

We cannot have skilled work force if we do not solve this problem! Sometimes, I get a little agitated when young boys and girls we work with in villages take 3-4 attempts to learn simple things. ‚ÄúWhy can‚Äôt you understand something so simple? Why are you not putting in the effort?‚Äù But then, if you see their physical health and diet, you will just know why. It is very expensive to have a nutritious meal, twice or thrice a day. In cities, we are aware abt vitamin, protein & mineral deficiencies and we can supplement it. We feel tired, doc tells us B12 could help. We feel constantly sad and body pains, a doctor tells us Vit D could help. But this is so unheard of for most Indians. Most people in rural India are far from being healthy enough to learn new skills and use mental cognitive abilities at reasonable capacity. To have chemicals that strengthen our logical, analytical reasoning ability, to memorise stuff, our brain needs nutrition. Education system or skill India jese initiatives kya kar lenge jab insaan ka shareer aur dimag hi kamzor hai? Right now we are only producing labour that is not upskill-able. Zeal, joy, confidence, willingness to work hard - these are all chemical & hormonal triggers. We need food that keeps hormones in check. It is sooo painful to see what kids get at so many mid day schools. Itne weak hai ye bachhe physically bhi its unreasonable to expect them to learn well or get medals for us at Olympics. We really need to solve this. Nutrition that is affordable and accessible for Bharatüôè If govt could do it, they would have. So much leakage in between. Pata nahi kese chote bachho ke hakk ka khana churane walo ke gale se khana utarta hai.

100% agreed to this - in my experience, working with a full-time team of 80+, optimal working hours is 5 hours. Even I can‚Äôt work productively for more than 6-7 hours a day, rest of the time it‚Äôs only doing mundane work or as we call it in office ‚Äòexecutive time pass‚Äô. Whenever team members work for more than normal hours, I just know something is not right in their personal life & they are just overworking to distract themselves. That‚Äôs not sustainable. I‚Äôm lucky to work in a place where, if my mood tanks or anxiety kicks in, my boss doesn‚Äôt just give me a pep talk ‚Äì they hand me a punching bag or a sleeping bed to smash or snooze it out! And when that‚Äôs done, they even order food to refuel the soul. Now that‚Äôs how you handle bad vibes ‚Äì with punches, naps, and snacks!

Coffee lovers of LinkedIn, need a small favour .. If you know of good coffee places in Mumbai, not too noisy, where you can sit and have a conversation, please get off LinkedIn and go there with your friends
The difference between a good boss and a bad boss is your appraisal rating ..

Today I booked a cab & the cab driver did not call me to find out where I wanted to go, did not cancel, reached on time at the exact correct location.. As you can guess I was so shocked by this behaviour that the first thing I told him when I saw him was ‚ÄúYou forgot to bring the car‚Äù
